intro: Tibouchina rotundifolia, commonly known as the confetti bush, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its dense, rounded foliage and showy clusters of pink or violet flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value. Tibouchina rotundifolia is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
